data.Title: Google Search Console Performance Reports Fixed After Outage
data.Description: Google Search Console Performance reports are now fully caught up and showing accurate data after a significant delay and period of inaccurate data.

data.Title: Reddit Does Not Block Google Search
data.Description: Despite rumors circulating on July 4th, Reddit has not blocked Google Search from crawling and indexing its content.

data.Title: Google Updates Image SEO Best Practices
data.Description: Google has updated the "Use HTML image elements to embed images" section of its image SEO best practices.

data.Title: Google Explains Why Negative SEO Is Ineffective
data.Description: Google's Gary Illyes has reiterated that negative SEO links do not work, confirming what link builders have known for years.

data.Title: Google Testing Wider Search Bar
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a wider search bar, potentially to accommodate longer search queries.

data.Title: Cloudflare Launches Tool to Block AI Data Scraping
data.Description: Cloudflare has released a tool that aims to prevent bots from scraping website data for AI training purposes. The tool is available for free to all Cloudflare customers.

data.Title: OpenAI Updates ChatGPT App for macOS to Encrypt Local Conversations
data.Description: OpenAI has updated its ChatGPT app for macOS to encrypt locally stored conversations. This update comes after a user discovered that the app was storing chats in plain text.

data.Title: OpenAI Requests New York Times Source Materials in Copyright Case
data.Description: OpenAI is requesting access to journalists' source materials from the New York Times to support its defense in a multi-million dollar copyright infringement lawsuit.

data.Title: YouTube Enhances Erase Song Tool with AI for Copyright Management
data.Description: YouTube has updated its Erase Song tool for creators, incorporating an AI algorithm to detect and remove copyrighted music from videos without affecting other audio.

data.Title: Google's Antitrust Trial and Potential Impact on Mobile Search
data.Description: If Google loses the ongoing Department of Justice antitrust trial, it could lose access to a significant portion of mobile searches conducted on iPhones, potentially impacting its market share.

data.Title: Google Considered Limiting AI Overviews to Own Apps
data.Description: To reduce reliance on Safari for iOS, Google contemplated restricting AI Overviews to its own mobile apps but ultimately decided against it.

data.Title: Can Employers See Bing Searches from Work Accounts?
data.Description: A recent article explores whether employers can access Bing search history when employees use their work email addresses and Microsoft 365 accounts.

data.Title: Microsoft Rewards Program: Get Paid to Use Bing
data.Description: Microsoft offers incentives to users who switch from Google to its Bing search engine through the Microsoft Rewards Program.
